cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest, expected to cross western Cuba Tuesday, enter the Gulf of Mexico Wednesday, and move toward the Louisiana coast late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to southeast Louisiana coast (near Morgan City–Lake Charles corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the western Florida Panhandle, with greatest focus on the Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are increasingly likely late Friday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Delta strengthens rapidly before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 3–5 ft of surge possible in Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, and along the southeast Louisiana coast, including the New Orleans levee system.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday with localized higher totals, bringing flash-flood risk across the port region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding outside the levee system, dangerous seas and swell in approaches to the Mississippi River, and possible brief tornadoes in outer rain bands.
